title: Job Training Academy Website

requirements.text: Create a Home page with a bold headline ('Upgrade Your Skills. Get Job Ready.'), a short academy intro paragraph, a highlights section showcasing up to 3–4 featured courses, prominent 'Enroll Now' CTA buttons, a testimonials section with student quotes, and a footer containing contact details and placeholder social media links.

quotes: Footer with contact details and social links

acceptanceCriteria: Headline is visible above the fold on desktop and mobile
Featured courses section links to the Courses page
At least one 'Enroll Now' CTA button scrolls to or links to course enrollment
Testimonials section renders at least 3 sample testimonials
Footer displays contact info and social link icons

requirements.text: Create a Courses page that lists all available courses in a responsive card/grid layout. Each card must display: course title, short description, duration, fees, and an 'Enroll Now' button. Each card must be clickable to navigate to its Course Detail page.

quotes: List of all available courses in card/grid format

acceptanceCriteria: Courses are fetched from the backend and rendered as cards
Grid is responsive (1 column on mobile, 2–3 on desktop)
Each card shows title, description, duration, fees, and Enroll Now button
Clicking a card navigates to the Course Detail page for that course

requirements.text: Create a Course Detail page showing the full course description, syllabus breakdown (list of topics), trainer name and bio, batch timings, pricing, and an 'Enroll Now' button. The page must be reachable via a route parameterized by course ID.
acceptanceCriteria: Route accepts a course ID parameter and loads the correct course
All fields (description, syllabus, trainer, batch timings, price) are displayed
'Enroll Now' button is visible and functional

requirements.text: Implement a backend data model for courses. Each course record must store: title, short description, full description, syllabus (array of topics), trainer name, trainer bio, batch timings, fees, and Zoom meeting link. Expose CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete) for courses accessible from the admin dashboard.

quotes: Admin should be able to update Zoom links easily from dashboard

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor stores course records with all required fields
getCourses, getCourse, addCourse, updateCourse, deleteCourse methods are implemented
Zoom meeting link is a field on each course record and can be updated independently

requirements.text: Implement a backend data model for enrollments. Each enrollment record must store: student name, email, phone number, course ID, payment status (pending/paid), and enrollment timestamp. Expose methods to create an enrollment and list all enrollments.
acceptanceCriteria: Enrollment records are persisted in stable storage
createEnrollment and getEnrollments methods are implemented
Payment status field accepts 'pending' or 'paid' values

requirements.text: Build a simulated checkout/enrollment flow on the Enroll Now button. When a student clicks 'Enroll Now' on a course, show a checkout form collecting name, email, and phone. On form submission, create an enrollment record in the backend with status 'pending', display an on-screen confirmation message, and redirect to a Thank You page. Include a visible note that payment gateway integration (Razorpay/Instamowo) requires external credentials not available in this environment.
acceptanceCriteria: Checkout form collects name, email, and phone
Submitting the form creates an enrollment record in the backend
User is redirected to a /thank-you page after submission
Thank You page displays a confirmation message with the course name
A note about payment gateway integration is displayed on the checkout form

requirements.text: Build a Thank You page that displays a confirmation message, the enrolled course name, and a note that the student will receive a Zoom meeting link at their registered email address once the admin confirms enrollment.

quotes: After enrollment, students receive Zoom meeting link via email

acceptanceCriteria: Thank You page is accessible at /thank-you
Page displays a congratulations message and the course name
Page informs the student to check their email for the Zoom link

requirements.text: Create a Contact page with a contact form (fields: Name, Email, Phone, Message), a WhatsApp click-to-chat button (linking to a placeholder WhatsApp number), a displayed phone number and email address, and a placeholder section for a Google Maps embed.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form renders all four fields and a Submit button
WhatsApp button opens wa.me link in a new tab
Phone and email are displayed as clickable links (tel: and mailto:)
Google Maps placeholder section is visible with an explanatory label

requirements.text: Build an Admin Dashboard page accessible at /admin. The dashboard must support: listing all courses with edit and delete actions, adding a new course (form with all course fields including Zoom link), editing an existing course (pre-filled form), viewing all enrollments with student name, email, course, and payment status, and manually marking an enrollment as paid.

quotes: Admin should be able to update Zoom links easily from dashboard

acceptanceCriteria: Admin dashboard is accessible at /admin
Course list shows all courses with Edit and Delete buttons
Add Course form saves a new course to the backend
Edit Course form pre-fills existing data and updates the record
Delete removes the course from the backend
Enrollments table shows name, email, course, and payment status
Admin can click a button to mark an enrollment as paid

requirements.text: Apply a professional visual theme across the entire site: clean sans-serif typography, a minimal color palette of deep navy blue (#1E3A5F), white, and light grey, generous whitespace, card-based layouts with subtle shadows, and a sticky top navigation bar with links to Home, Courses, Contact, and Admin. Ensure full mobile responsiveness.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigation bar is sticky and includes links to all main pages
Navigation collapses to a hamburger menu on mobile
Color palette is consistently navy, white, and grey throughout
All pages are fully usable on a 375px-wide mobile viewport
Card components use consistent shadow and border-radius styling

constraints: Do not integrate actual Razorpay, Instamojo, Zoom, or email APIs — simulate those flows with UI feedback and backend state
Do not embed real Google Maps — use a clearly labeled placeholder section
Admin dashboard does not require authentication in this build
All Motoko logic must remain in a single backend actor
nonGoals: Zoom API integration for automatic meeting link delivery
SEO meta-tag optimization beyond standard HTML structure

required: Professional academy hero banner with abstract geometric shapes suggesting growth and education, navy blue tones with white accents (hero-banner.dim_1200x400.png)
Simple graduation cap icon illustration in navy blue on transparent background (graduation-icon.dim_128x128.png)
